title: paragraph 5(5) (as amended by section 4 of the Milk (Regulation of Supply)
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the National Milk Agency (Conduct
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the National Milk Agency (Conduct 

of Elections) (Amendment) Regulations 2024.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited national milk agency (conduct elections) (amendment) regulation 2024

title: paragraph 5(5) (as amended by section 4 of the Milk (Regulation of Supply)
heading: 2. The National Milk Agency (Conduct of Elections) Regulations 1997 (S.
text_raw:
2. The National Milk Agency (Conduct of Elections) Regulations 1997 (S. 

I. No. 185 of 1997) are amended by: 

(a) 

substituting for Regulation 4(2) (as amended by the National Milk 
Agency (Conduct of Elections) (Amendment) Regulations 2021 
(S.I. No. 373 of 2021), the following- 

“(2) (a) The registered producers who have supplied raw milk 
for heat treatment for liquid consumption to one or more of the 
following- 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

(iv) 

Tirlán Limited, 

Lakeland Dairies Co-Operative Society Limited, 

Aurivo Co-operative Society Limited, 

Glenisk Limited 

comprise a constituency and are entitled to elect 3 producer 
members to the National Milk Agency, and 

(b) 

The registered producers who have supplied raw milk for 
heat treatment for liquid consumption to one or more of the 
following– 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

(iv) 

(v) 

 (vi) 

The Village Dairy Limited, 

Mossfield Organic Farm Ltd., 

Bainne Codladh Ltd., 

Arrabawn Co-operative Society Limited, 

Clona Dairy Products Society Limited, 

Dairygold Co-operative Society Limited (as agent 
for Tirlán Limited), 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 12th July, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [340] 3 

(vii) 

Dawn Dairies Limited (Kerry Creameries Limited 
T/A Kerry Agribusiness – Dairies, 

(viii) 

Lee Strand Co-operative Creamery Limited, 

(ix) 

(x) 

North Cork Co-operative Creameries Limited, 

Centenary Thurles Co-operative Society Limited 
(Thurles Fresh Milk Limited) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

comprise a constituency and are entitled to elect 2 producer 
members to the National Milk Agency.”, 

the amendment of Regulation 13 by the substitution of “the 
closing date for receipt of nomination papers” for “the nomination 
day”, 

the amendment of Regulation 20(a) by the substitution of “the 
place and times for the counting of votes, the date (“the ballot 
return day”) by which completed ballot papers must be received 
by the returning officer;” for “the place and times for the counting 
of votes;” and 

the amendment of Regulation 28(1) by the substitution of “On the 
working day next following the ballot return day, or such other 
day as may be approved by the returning officer” for “At the hour 
of 2.00 p.m. on the day next following the day on which the return 
of all ballot papers issued at an election to the returning officer is 
completed”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 June, 2024. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [340]

title: paragraph 5(5) (as amended by section 4 of the Milk (Regulation of Supply)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to establish constituencies for the election 
of producer members to the National Milk Agency and to further provide for the 
ballot return day, and the day for opening ballot boxes. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [340] 5
